Nodes.Text: Halt, traveler. I am the warden of this village. State your business.
Then pass through peacefully. We don't tolerate troublemakers here, but honest travelers are welcome. The elder can tell you more about the area if you need guidance.
This is a small settlement, but we look after our own. The elder leads us, the merchant trades goods, and I keep watch. We've had our share of trouble from the wilds, but we endure.
The usual -- beasts from the wilds, bandits on the roads. Lately the creatures have been bolder. Something's stirring them up. I've doubled my patrols, but one warden can only do so much.

Choices.Text: I could help deal with some of those threats.

Nodes.Text: A willing blade is always welcome. Clear out some of the beasts near the village and you'll have our gratitude -- and maybe a reward from the elder.

Choices.Text: I'll see what I can do.

Nodes.Text: Depends on where you are. Near the caves it's snapjaws and bats. The desert has scorpions and bandits. The jungle is full of spiders and vipers. And the old ruins... I don't like to think about what lurks in the ruins.
